com.googlecode.aluminumproject.utilities

Class Injector

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.googlecode.aluminumproject.utilities.Injector

  • public class Injector
extends Object
    Injects values into fields that are annotated with @Injected. Which values are injected by an injector depends on the value providers that are added to it.

    An injector is not required to inject all of an object's annotated fields; this allows multiple injectors to be used for the same injectable object.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Injector.ClassBasedValueProvider
      Provides a constant value if it can be assigned to a field.
      static interface  Injector.ValueProvider
      Provides a value for certain fields.

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addValueProvider(Injector.ValueProvider valueProvider)
      Adds a value provider to this injector.
      void inject(Object injectable)
      Loops through an object's non-static fields and injects a value into each one that is annotated with @Injected and for which a value provider exists.

      • inject

        public void inject(Object injectable)
            throws AluminumException
        Loops through an object's non-static fields and injects a value into each one that is annotated with @Injected and for which a value provider exists.
        Parameters:
        injectable - the object to fill
        Throws:
        AluminumException - when something goes wrong while injecting the values
